intro: Oxalis coppolerii, commonly known as the Cape mountain wood sorrel, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Oxalidaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It is known for its ornamental value and is often cultivated in gardens for its attractive foliage and delicate blooms. Oxalis coppolerii is also valued for its ability to tolerate drought conditions once established.
